item.title: Elon Musk shares deepfake Harris video, violating X rules
item.description: Elon Musk shared a digitally manipulated campaign video of Kamala Harris, which altered her voice-over to make misleading statements about her and Joe Biden. The video violated X's policies against deceptive media. The Harris campaign condemned Musk's action and emphasizes their campaign's message of real freedom and security.

item.title: Venezuelans choose between another prez term for Maduro or a big change
item.description: In Venezuela, citizens voted in a crucial presidential election that could either bring political change or prolong the policies blamed for the country's economic crisis. Incumbent President Nicolas Maduro faced opposition from retired diplomat Edmundo Gonzalez. The election coincided with the late President Hugo Chavez's 70th birthday, with polls open from 6am to 6pm local time.

item.title: Shanghai museum opens for felines amid rising 'cat parents'
item.description: Shanghai Museum hosted its first ancient Egypt cat night, attended by numerous cat lovers and their pets. This innovative event reflects China's growing pet ownership, with over 120 million pets in 2023, and cats being the most popular. The museum has planned nine more cat nights, tapping into younger generations' affinity for cats as cheaper substitutes for children.

item.title: Fears of escalation after rocket from Lebanon kills 12 at Golan soccer field
item.description: Western diplomats worked to prevent escalating violence after a deadly rocket from Lebanon killed 12 in Israeli-controlled Golan Heights. Israel blamed Hezbollah and retaliated with strikes. US and French diplomats urged restraint, fearing all-out war. Israel's PM Netanyahu discussed further actions amid domestic calls for a stronger response.

item.title: '66% of Harris' $200m fund-haul in 1st week of campaign came from first-time donors'
item.description: Kamala Harris' campaign raised $200 million following President Biden's withdrawal and endorsement last week. The donations, primarily from first-time contributors, surged after the announcement. With 100 days to Election Day, over 170,000 volunteers have joined Harris' campaign. Trump's campaign reported $331 million raised in the second quarter, surpassing Biden and Democratic allies' $264 million in the same period.

item.title: Poll: Favourability rating of Kamala rises to 43% from 35% a week ago
item.description: Kamala Harris gained favourability among Americans after Joe Biden decided not to seek reelection, according to a recent ABC News/Ipsos poll. Her rating rose to 43%, while Donald Trump's declined to 36%. Harris described herself as the 'underdog' but noted growing momentum for her campaign during a Massachusetts fundraiser attended by 800 supporters.

Bilawal Bhutto Zardari's party says ready to talk with Imran Khan
US elections: Kamala Harris' campaign raises record $200 million in first week, signs up 170,000 volunteers
item.description: Kamala Harris' campaign raised $200 million in the first week after she became the Democratic presidential nominee following Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. She gained the support of over 170,000 volunteers and several prominent Democrats, including the Obamas. Despite her growing support, Harris continues to consider herself an underdog in the race.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US's Blinken calls on Venezuela parties to 'respect democratic process' in vote
item.description: Ahead of the Venezuelan election, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged all parties to respect the democratic process. Incumbent President Nicolas Maduro faces strong opposition from Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia. Tensions are high, as Maduro threatened violence if he loses. The US stressed that any lifting of sanctions depends on the fairness of the vote.

item.title: Putin threatens to restart production of intermediate-range nuclear weapons if US ...
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin threatened on Sunday that Russia could resume the production of intermediate-range nuclear missiles if the US deployed long-range missiles in Germany. He warned that such actions from the US might trigger a Cold War-style missile crisis. This statement followed the US announcement to deploy long-range fire capabilities in Germany by 2026, aiming to reinforce NATO and European defense.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Lithium battery fire traps drivers for hours on California highway
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Unforeseen consequences': Iran warns Israel over attacks on Lebanon after Golan strike
item.description: Iran warned Israel of unforeseen consequences after a deadly rocket strike in the Golan Heights linked to Hezbollah. Iran's foreign ministry spokesman stressed that Israeli actions could lead to instability and war. Tehran accused Israel of diverting attention from its actions in Gaza and insisted Israel would be held accountable for its conduct.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
